alert.note: Alert for Osborne; Phillips; Rooks (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 9:21AM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Up To 1 to 2 Inches of Snow Possible Through This Evening... Through the rest of the day, and possibly lingering into the first part of this evening, light snow will continue falling across mainly western portions of north central Kansas. By the time snow ends, parts of Phillips, Rooks and Osborne counties are expected to receive anywhere from one-half inch up to perhaps around 2 inches, with the greatest potential for around 2 inches favoring roughly the southwestern half of Rooks County. Fortunately, winds will remain light, only around 10 MPH or less, resulting in minimal blowing and drifting. Because snow amounts are expected to average under 2 inches across the vast majority of this area, a formal Winter Weather Advisory is not in effect. That being said, motorists should still be prepared for slick roads and exercise winter driving precautions.
